repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Update runtime files

https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/86b4816766d976a7ecd4403eca1f8bf6b4105800

@zeertzjq is the change to `doc/windows.txt` applicable?

Co-authored-by: Bram Moolenaar <Bram@vim.org>

comment_data.body:
Hmm, I'm not sure Nvim generates this keycode, though it does exist.

From a quick grep in Vim's source, I could only find this being generated in the GUI with `mousefocus` anyway... :thinking:
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -139,6 +139,11 @@ gN			Like |gn| but searches backward, like with `N`.
 			environment variable or the -display argument).  Only
 			when 'mouse' option contains 'n' or 'a'.
 
+<LeftMouseNM>		Internal mouse code, used for clicking on the status
+<LeftReleaseNM>		line to focus a window.  NM stands for non-mappable.
+			You cannot use these, but they might show up in some
+			places.

@@ -2,7 +2,7 @@
 " You can also use this as a start for your own set of menus.
 "
 " Maintainer:	Bram Moolenaar <Bram@vim.org>
-" Last Change:	2020 Mar 29
+" Last Change:	2020 Nov 27

comment_data.body: So should I remove it or leave it in?

comment_regular_data.body:
> is the change to doc/windows.txt applicable?

Yes
I think there's gonna be a supplementary runtime file update soon (today?), so might make sense to wait for and include that?
Waiting sounds fine. I've alerted Bram about the missing file. :pray:
Yeah... Maybe you should have mentioned that the zig ftplugin is completely broken without it?
Good point. I thought it may have been clear from the BufWritePre autocmd that I attached the comment to, but I've mentioned it explicitly now just in case. :P

Hey guys. This is an old issue, but maybe you can explain to me what triggers `function! zig#fmt#Format() abort` and how can I disable it? I don't want it to be called ever on my local machine. Is there a way to exclude the file from autoloading? Or something of the sorts

@Cethrivias It was triggered by a BufWritePre autocommand in `runtime/ftplugin/zig.vim`. Use `let g:zig_fmt_autosave = 0` to disable it.

The auto-formatting has since been removed in #28904, so this workaround won't be needed after 0.11.
